availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Clarinda Tackett Rasure (Julia Dean) (Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, sex worker and madam.)

body.p: Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, sex worker and madam. Ohio native. Married to David Rasure. Mother of Sarah Jane Rasure, Emela Rasure, Amaziah "Sam" Rasure, Amelia Rasure, David Rasure, Jr., George W. Rasure, and Francis M. Rasure. Resident of New Albany, Floyd County, Indiana, in 1850. Sex worker and madam in Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, in 1860. Held in Gratiot Street Military Prison in St. Louis, Missouri, on September 3, 1864, for counterfeiting.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Indiana, Floyd County, New Albany, p. 392A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 1, p. 195-196.
Union Provost Marshals' File of Paper Relating to Individual Civilians, NARA RG 109, Roll 0025.
Crystal N. Feimster, "Keeping a Disorderly House in Civil War Kentucky," The Register of the Kentucky Historical Society 117, no. 2 (Spring 2019): 301-322.
